If \\( g(x) \\) is applied to an initial state \\( x_0 \\) at t = 0, then the system is allowed to evolve according to \\( \\dot{x} = Ax^2 + Bx \\) without further intervention, will \\( x(t) \\) at t = T match that of an evolution from \\( x_0 \\) to t = T under the original system?
Explanation: The transformation \\( g(x) \\) alters the initial conditions, typically changing the integral curve of the differential equation. The new initial condition modifies not only the path but potentially the entire behavior of the system, especially given the nonlinearity introduced by \\( Ax^2 + Bx \\).
